conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Point A is located at the top left, point B is in the middle, and point C is at the top right. Containers D and E are at the bottom left and bottom right respectively.
There are multiple baffles in the image, angled to direct the flow of liquid.
Liquid from point A flows downward and encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
After passing the first baffle, the liquid from point A continues downward and hits another baffle that directs it further to the right.
The liquid from point A continues downward and ends up in container D.
Liquid from point B flows downward and encounters a baffle that directs it to the left.
After passing the first baffle, the liquid from point B continues downward and hits another baffle that directs it further to the left.
The liquid from point B continues downward and ends up in container D.
Liquid from point C flows downward and encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
After passing the first baffle, the liquid from point C continues downward and hits another baffle that directs it further to the right.
The liquid from point C continues downward and ends up in container E.
For points A and B, the liquid is consistently directed to the left by the baffles, leading it into container D.
For point C, the liquid is consistently directed to the right by the baffles, leading it into container E.
The liquid from points A and B will flow into container D, and the liquid from point C will flow into container E.
